verbs.description: immobilize (third-person singular simple present immobilizes, present participle immobilizing, simple past and past participle immobilized)

entries.meaning: To render motionless; to stop moving or stop from moving.
examples: It is best to immobilize the injury until a doctor can examine it.

entries.meaning: To modify a surface such that things will not stick to it
(finance) To tie up a capital: make a capital investment that makes that capital unavailable.
examples: Don't immobilize your capital in aging accounts.
